mainEntity.name: What programs does Chroma Academy offer?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Academy offers a variety of programs for children aged 6 weeks to 12 years, including child care, daycare, and early childhood education, all designed around our unique Prismpath™ curriculum that fosters holistic development.

mainEntity.name: How can I enroll my child?

acceptedAnswer.text: Enrolling your child at Chroma Early Learning Academy is simple. Visit our website to fill out the enrollment form or contact us directly to schedule a tour and discuss your options.

mainEntity.name: What age groups does Chroma serve?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy serves children aged 6 weeks to 12 years, offering a range of child care and early childhood education programs tailored to various developmental stages.

mainEntity.name: What is the Prismpath™ curriculum?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Prismpath™ curriculum is a unique educational framework designed to promote holistic development in children. It integrates various learning modalities to foster creativity, critical thinking, and emotional growth, ensuring a well-rounded early childhood education experience.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma support child development?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma supports child development through its unique Prismpath™ curriculum, which fosters holistic growth by integrating cognitive, social, emotional, and physical learning experiences tailored to each child's needs.

mainEntity.name: What are the hours of operation?

acceptedAnswer.text: The hours of operation for Chroma Early Learning Academy are Monday through Friday, from 6:30 AM to 6:30 PM, providing flexible care options for families in the Metro Atlanta area.

mainEntity.name: Are there any enrollment fees?

acceptedAnswer.text: Enrollment fees at Chroma Early Learning Academy are applicable. Please contact us directly for detailed information regarding the specific fees associated with our enrollment process.

mainEntity.name: What is the teacher-to-child ratio?

acceptedAnswer.text: The teacher-to-child ratio at Chroma Early Learning Academy is designed to ensure personalized attention and support for each child. We maintain a low ratio to foster effective learning and development in a nurturing environment.

mainEntity.name: How can I schedule a tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: Scheduling a tour at Chroma Early Learning Academy is simple. You can visit our website to select a convenient date and time or contact us directly via phone to arrange your visit.

mainEntity.name: What safety measures are in place?

acceptedAnswer.text: The safety measures in place at Chroma Early Learning Academy include secure access controls, regular safety drills, trained staff in emergency procedures, and comprehensive health protocols to ensure a safe environment for all children.

mainEntity.name: What activities are included in the curriculum?

acceptedAnswer.text: The activities included in the curriculum focus on holistic development through interactive play, arts and crafts, music, storytelling, and outdoor exploration, all designed to foster creativity, critical thinking, and social skills in children.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma handle special needs?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy accommodates special needs by providing individualized support and tailored learning plans. Our trained staff collaborates with families to ensure each child's unique requirements are met within a nurturing and inclusive environment.

mainEntity.name: What are the payment options available?

acceptedAnswer.text: The available payment options at Chroma Early Learning Academy include credit and debit card payments, electronic bank transfers, and checks. We strive to offer flexible solutions to accommodate your financial needs.

mainEntity.name: Is there a summer program offered?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy offers a summer program designed to engage children with enriching activities and learning experiences throughout the season. This program is available for children aged 6 weeks to 12 years.

mainEntity.name: What qualifications do the teachers have?

acceptedAnswer.text: The qualifications of our teachers include degrees in early childhood education, relevant certifications, and ongoing professional development to ensure they provide the highest quality of care and education for your child.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma communicate with parents?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma communicates with parents through regular updates via newsletters, parent-teacher conferences, and a dedicated online portal, ensuring that families are informed and engaged in their child's educational journey.

mainEntity.name: What is the daily schedule like?

acceptedAnswer.text: The daily schedule at Chroma Early Learning Academy is structured to provide a balanced mix of learning and play. Each day includes engaging activities, outdoor playtime, meals, and rest periods, all designed to support children's holistic development.

mainEntity.name: Are meals provided at the academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: Meals are provided at Chroma Early Learning Academy. We offer nutritious and balanced meals to ensure that children receive the necessary nourishment throughout their day of learning and play.

mainEntity.name: What is the philosophy of Chroma Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: The philosophy of Chroma Academy centers on fostering holistic development through its unique Prismpath™ curriculum, which emphasizes nurturing each child's individual strengths and interests while promoting a love for learning in a supportive environment.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma promote social skills?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma promotes social skills through collaborative activities, guided play, and group projects that encourage communication, sharing, and teamwork among children, fostering a supportive environment for developing interpersonal relationships and emotional intelligence.

mainEntity.name: What are the benefits of early education?

acceptedAnswer.text: The benefits of early education are numerous, including enhanced cognitive development, improved social skills, and a strong foundation for lifelong learning. Early education fosters creativity and critical thinking, setting children up for future academic success.

mainEntity.name: How can I get updates on events?

acceptedAnswer.text: To receive updates on events at Chroma Early Learning Academy, you can subscribe to our newsletter on our website or follow us on our social media channels for the latest announcements and activities.

mainEntity.name: What is the process for transitioning to school?

acceptedAnswer.text: The process for transitioning to school involves preparing children for the shift from early learning environments to formal education. At Chroma Early Learning Academy, we support this transition through tailored programs, open communication with families, and gradual exposure to school routines.

mainEntity.name: Are there parent involvement opportunities?

acceptedAnswer.text: Parent involvement opportunities are available at Chroma Early Learning Academy. We encourage parents to participate in events, volunteer in the classroom, and engage in our community activities to foster a collaborative learning environment.

mainEntity.name: What makes Chroma different from other academies?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma stands out from other academies due to its unique Prismpath™ curriculum, which focuses on holistic development and personalized learning experiences tailored to each child's needs, fostering creativity and critical thinking from an early age.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma assess child progress?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma assesses child progress through ongoing observations, developmental checklists, and regular assessments aligned with the Prismpath™ curriculum, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of each child's growth and learning journey.

mainEntity.name: What extracurricular activities are available?

acceptedAnswer.text: The extracurricular activities available at Chroma Early Learning Academy include art, music, physical education, and outdoor exploration, all designed to enhance children's creativity, social skills, and physical development.

mainEntity.name: What is the maximum class size?

acceptedAnswer.text: The maximum class size at Chroma Early Learning Academy is designed to ensure personalized attention and effective learning. Typically, our classes accommodate up to 10-12 children, fostering a nurturing environment for each child's development.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma incorporate play in learning?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma incorporates play in learning by integrating hands-on, interactive activities within its Prismpath™ curriculum, allowing children to explore, experiment, and engage creatively, which enhances their cognitive, social, and emotional development.

schemas.name: Melissa Leonard
schemas.description:
Melissa Leonard is a passionate leader in early childhood education and a proud mother of three. Born and raised in Cumming, Georgia, she recently relocated to Gainesville, where she continues to build strong connections within the community. Melissa enjoys spending her free time supporting her children’s activities—watching her son play football and cheering on her daughters at their cheer events. She is also a devoted Georgia Bulldogs fan.
With a deep-rooted passion for early childhood education, Melissa is driven by her desire to make a meaningful and lasting impact in the lives of children. She is dedicated to fostering strong, trusting relationships with families and believes in creating a nurturing, supportive, and high-quality learning environment where every child and family feels valued. Her commitment, energy, and genuine heart for children are evident in all that she does.

schemas.name: Christie Kraft
schemas.description:
Christie has been part of this Midway location since January 2007 and truly considers it her second home. With more than 12 years of experience as both a Lead Georgia Pre-K Teacher and Center Director, Christie brings a wealth of knowledge and dedication to early childhood education.

She is passionate about traveling, decorating, and teaching science, but her greatest joy comes from spending time with her family, her husband Rick, their two children, Jake and Emily, and their four beloved Burmese cats.

Christie’s goal is to bring quality, consistency, and love to the Midway program so that every child and family feels right at home.

employee.name: Chelsea Brown
employee.description:
Chelsey Brown is a dedicated early childhood education leader with a deep belief that the early years are the most impactful period in a child’s life. She is passionate about building meaningful relationships with children and families and creating supportive, nurturing environments where everyone can grow and flourish. 
Throughout her career, Chelsey has worked as a classroom teacher, education specialist, consultant, and Director of Children’s Experience in a museum setting—all within the field of early care and learning. She also spent several years living and teaching abroad in China, including time in Beijing and Shanghai. These experiences shaped her global perspective and deepened her appreciation for creativity, connection, and cultural understanding in education.
As an educator and leader, Chelsey is committed to creating positive, engaging spaces for both children and staff. Her guiding expectations are simple and intentional: be safe, be kind, do your best, and have fun.

Education
Chelsey earned her bachelor’s degree in Human Environmental Science with a concentration in Human Development from The University of Alabama (Roll Tide!). In 2021, she completed a master’s degree in Early Childhood Education Leadership and, in August 2025, earned a second master’s degree in Psychology.

mainEntity.name: What programs are offered at Chroma Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy offers a range of programs designed for children aged 6 weeks to 12 years, focusing on early education, developmental activities, and enriching experiences. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How do I enroll my child?

acceptedAnswer.text: Enrolling your child at Chroma Early Learning Academy is simple. Just visit our website to complete the online enrollment form or contact our office for assistance. We look forward to welcoming your family to Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What age groups does Chroma serve?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy serves children from 6 weeks to 12 years old, providing a nurturing environment for their growth and development.

mainEntity.name: What are the facility features at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The facility features at Chroma include spacious classrooms, outdoor play areas, and age-appropriate learning resources designed to foster children's growth and development. These amenities ensure a safe and engaging environment at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma ensure child safety?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma ensures child safety through rigorous safety protocols, including secure facility access, trained staff, regular safety drills, and comprehensive health policies. These measures create a safe environment for children at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the curriculum focus at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The curriculum focus at Chroma emphasizes holistic development, fostering creativity, critical thinking, and social skills through engaging, age-appropriate activities. This approach supports children's growth in a nurturing environment at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there any parent testimonials available?

acceptedAnswer.text: Parent testimonials are available and can provide valuable insights into the experiences of families at our academy. You can find these testimonials on our website, showcasing the positive impact of Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What are the operating hours of Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The operating hours of Chroma Early Learning Academy are Monday to Friday, from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM.

acceptedAnswer.text: To schedule a campus tour, simply contact us through our website or call our office to set up an appointment. We look forward to showing you around Chroma Early Learning Academy.

acceptedAnswer.text: The qualifications of the staff members include degrees in early childhood education, specialized training in child development, and certifications in CPR and first aid, ensuring high-quality care at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

acceptedAnswer.text: There is a waiting list for enrollment at Chroma Early Learning Academy, as spaces can fill up quickly due to high demand. To secure a spot, we encourage you to contact us for more information at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the curriculum focus at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The curriculum focus at Chroma emphasizes holistic development, fostering creativity, critical thinking, and social skills through engaging, age-appropriate activities. This approach supports children's growth in a nurturing environment at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there any parent testimonials available?

acceptedAnswer.text: Parent testimonials are available and can provide valuable insights into the experiences of families at our academy. You can find these testimonials on our website, showcasing the positive impact of Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What are the operating hours of Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The operating hours of Chroma Early Learning Academy are Monday to Friday, from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM.

mainEntity.name: How can I schedule a campus tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: To schedule a campus tour, simply contact us through our website or call our office to set up an appointment. We look forward to showing you around Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What qualifications do the staff members have?

acceptedAnswer.text: The qualifications of the staff members include degrees in early childhood education, specialized training in child development, and certifications in CPR and first aid, ensuring high-quality care at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Is there a waiting list for enrollment?

acceptedAnswer.text: There is a waiting list for enrollment at Chroma Early Learning Academy, as spaces can fill up quickly due to high demand. To secure a spot, we encourage you to contact us for more information at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What activities are included in the program?

acceptedAnswer.text: The activities included in the program focus on holistic development, featuring creative arts, outdoor play, STEM learning, and social interaction, all designed to nurture children's growth at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma support child development?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma supports child development by providing a nurturing environment that fosters learning through play, individualized attention, and a curriculum designed to enhance cognitive, social, and emotional growth. This commitment to holistic development is central to Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the student-to-teacher ratio?

acceptedAnswer.text: The student-to-teacher ratio at Chroma Early Learning Academy is designed to ensure personalized attention and quality care, typically ranging from 1:4 to 1:10, depending on the age group. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are meals provided at Chroma Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: Meals are provided at Chroma Early Learning Academy to ensure children receive nutritious and balanced options throughout the day.

mainEntity.name: What is the tuition fee structure?

acceptedAnswer.text: The tuition fee structure at Chroma Early Learning Academy varies based on the age of the child and the selected program. For detailed information, please contact us directly at our Satellite Blvd Campus, Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma handle special needs children?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy is committed to providing individualized support and tailored programs for children with special needs, ensuring they receive the care and education necessary for their development.

mainEntity.name: What outdoor facilities are available?

acceptedAnswer.text: The outdoor facilities available include a spacious playground, shaded areas for relaxation, and safe surfaces for active play. These amenities are designed to promote physical development and outdoor learning at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there after-school programs offered?

acceptedAnswer.text: After-school programs are offered at our facility to provide enriching activities and supervision for children. These programs are designed to support children's growth and development at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the process for withdrawing a child?

acceptedAnswer.text: The process for withdrawing a child involves notifying the administration at least two weeks in advance and completing any required withdrawal forms. For detailed guidance, please contact Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma communicate with parents?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy communicates with parents through regular updates via newsletters, email, and parent-teacher conferences, ensuring they stay informed about their child's progress and campus activities at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What safety protocols are in place?

acceptedAnswer.text: The safety protocols in place at Chroma Early Learning Academy include secure entry systems, regular safety drills, and trained staff in first aid and emergency response. These measures ensure a safe environment for all children at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there any seasonal events at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: Seasonal events are an integral part of the experience at Chroma Early Learning Academy, providing opportunities for children and families to engage in fun and educational activities throughout the year at our Satellite Blvd Campus, Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the philosophy of Chroma Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: The philosophy of Chroma Early Learning Academy focuses on fostering a nurturing and stimulating environment that promotes holistic development, creativity, and a love for learning in children. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How can I contact Chroma for more information?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can contact Chroma for more information by calling our main office or visiting our website for additional details. We are here to assist you at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What makes Chroma different from other academies?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma stands out from other academies due to its commitment to creating a nurturing environment that prioritizes each child's individual development and well-being. This dedication to quality care and education is what sets Chroma Early Learning Academy apart.

mainEntity.name: Are there opportunities for parent involvement?

acceptedAnswer.text: Opportunities for parent involvement are abundant at Chroma Early Learning Academy, including volunteering in classrooms, participating in events, and joining parent-teacher organizations to foster a strong community connection. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What languages are taught at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The languages taught at Chroma Early Learning Academy include English and Spanish, fostering bilingual development in a nurturing environment. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma prepare children for school?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma prepares children for school by fostering essential skills through a structured curriculum, engaging activities, and social interactions that promote readiness for academic challenges. This holistic approach supports their development at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

employee.name: Shekrelia Davis
employee.description:
Hi Chroma Early Learning Academy Friends,

My name is Shekrelia Davis. I have over twenty years of experience working with children in a childcare facility and owning and operating a home daycare center for six years. I love and enjoy interacting and engaging with children, whether it is through reading, music, laughter, or just being silly. I get complete joy whenever a child laughs; it brightens my day. 

I am a true Georgia Peach. I was born and raised in Decatur, Georgia. So, you know that means I am a diehard Atlanta Falcons, Braves, Hawks, and UGA Bull Dogs fan for life!

I have a Bachelor of Science Degree in Business Management and am currently working on obtaining a Master of Education in Early Childhood Education.

I am the mother of two young men who blessed me with seven beautiful grandchildren. I am an active member at my church and work faithfully within the Women’s Ministry (Crowned Jewels).

I am a “Finer” Woman of Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Inc., Sigma Omicron Gwinnett Chapter. Where we demonstrate a commitment to scholarship, service, sisterhood, and finer womanhood.

schemas.name: Tramore Campus, Austell
schemas.description: Chroma Early Learning is a trusted childcare and early learning center in Austell, GA, offering high-quality daycare, preschool, and pre-K programs tailored to each child’s unique needs. Our experienced and passionate educators create a safe, nurturing environment where children feel supported, confident, and excited to learn. We emphasize the importance of early childhood education through a thoughtfully designed curriculum that promotes cognitive, social, emotional, and physical development. Through hands-on activities, creative exploration, and engaging learning experiences, we foster curiosity, creativity, and critical thinking skills while building a strong foundation for lifelong learning. Contact Austell Learning Academy today to learn more or schedule a tour.

schemas.name: Deanna Kauffman
schemas.description:
With five years of experience in both teaching and management, DeAnna is a compassionate leader who understands the lasting impact of early childhood experiences.

She is dedicated to creating a warm, engaging environment where curiosity, creativity, and confidence can flourish. At Chroma ELA, DeAnna’s nurturing approach supports not only children but their families, building strong, trusting relationships along the way.

At home, she finds joy in spending time with her husband and two daughters whether they’re playing board games, cooking, or making music together. DeAnna’s blend of professional expertise and heartfelt care makes her a valued partner in every child’s growth and success.

mainEntity.name: What programs does Chroma Early Learning Academy offer?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy offers a variety of childcare and preschool programs designed to support early childhood education and development. These programs cater to different age groups, ensuring a nurturing environment for all children at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

acceptedAnswer.text: To schedule a tour at Chroma, simply visit our website and fill out the tour request form, or contact us directly by phone. We look forward to welcoming you to Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What age groups does Chroma cater to?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy caters to children from infants through preschool age, providing tailored programs that support their growth and development. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the enrollment process for Chroma Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: The enrollment process for Chroma Early Learning Academy involves scheduling a tour, completing an application, and submitting required documents to secure a spot for your child. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma ensure child safety?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma ensures child safety through strict security measures, including secure access points, regular safety drills, and trained staff who prioritize a safe environment for all children at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What are the benefits of early childhood education?

acceptedAnswer.text: The benefits of early childhood education include enhanced cognitive development, improved social skills, and a strong foundation for lifelong learning, ensuring children thrive academically and emotionally at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are meals provided at Chroma Early Learning Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: Meals are provided at Chroma Early Learning Academy to ensure that children receive nutritious and balanced options throughout the day. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the teacher-to-student ratio at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The teacher-to-student ratio at Chroma Early Learning Academy is designed to ensure personalized attention and support for each child, promoting effective learning and development. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma support child development?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy supports child development through age-appropriate programs that foster cognitive, social, and emotional growth, ensuring a nurturing environment tailored to each child's needs.

mainEntity.name: What are the operating hours of Chroma Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: The operating hours of Chroma Early Learning Academy are Monday through Friday, from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM.

mainEntity.name: Is there a parent communication system at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy has a robust parent communication system in place, ensuring that families stay informed and engaged with their child's progress and activities.

mainEntity.name: What extracurricular activities are available at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy offers a variety of extracurricular activities, including art, music, and physical education, designed to enhance children's development and creativity. These programs provide enriching experiences beyond the classroom at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma handle special needs education?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy is committed to providing inclusive education for children with special needs, offering tailored support and resources to ensure each child's unique learning requirements are met effectively at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What qualifications do Chroma teachers have?

acceptedAnswer.text: The qualifications of Chroma teachers include relevant degrees in early childhood education, specialized training, and ongoing professional development to ensure they provide the highest quality education at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there any parent testimonials for Chroma Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: Parent testimonials for Chroma Early Learning Academy highlight positive experiences and satisfaction with the nurturing environment and quality education provided for their children. Many parents express their trust and appreciation for Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the tuition fee structure at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The tuition fee structure at Chroma Early Learning Academy is designed to accommodate various programs and age groups, providing flexible payment options to meet the needs of families. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma incorporate play in learning?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy incorporates play into learning by using hands-on activities and interactive play to foster creativity, problem-solving, and social skills, creating an engaging educational environment for children. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What safety measures are in place at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The safety measures in place at Chroma Early Learning Academy include secure access controls, regular safety drills, and trained staff to ensure a safe environment for all children. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Can I visit Chroma without an appointment?

acceptedAnswer.text: Visiting Chroma Early Learning Academy without an appointment is not permitted to ensure personalized attention and a comprehensive experience. We encourage scheduling a tour in advance to fully explore our programs and facilities at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the philosophy behind Chromas curriculum?

acceptedAnswer.text: The philosophy behind Chroma Early Learning Academy's curriculum emphasizes holistic development, fostering creativity, and nurturing a love for learning through play-based experiences tailored to each child's unique needs and interests, ensuring a strong foundation for lifelong growth at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma promote social skills in children?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma promotes social skills in children by providing collaborative activities and structured play that encourage teamwork, communication, and empathy among peers, fostering a supportive environment for social development at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there any seasonal programs at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy offers a variety of seasonal programs designed to enrich children's learning experiences throughout the year.

mainEntity.name: What is the process for transitioning to kindergarten?

acceptedAnswer.text: The process for transitioning to kindergarten involves preparing children emotionally and academically, including visits to the new school, meeting teachers, and familiarizing them with the environment. At Chroma Early Learning Academy, we support this transition to ensure a smooth start.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma engage with the local community?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy actively engages with the local community through partnerships, events, and outreach programs that promote early childhood education and family involvement.

mainEntity.name: What technology is used in Chromas classrooms?

acceptedAnswer.text: The technology used in Chroma Early Learning Academy's classrooms includes interactive whiteboards, tablets for educational apps, and age-appropriate software to enhance learning experiences. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there opportunities for parent involvement at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: Opportunities for parent involvement at Chroma include volunteering in classrooms, participating in events, and joining parent committees, fostering a strong community connection and enhancing children's learning experiences at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma assess child progress?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma assesses child progress through regular observations, developmental screenings, and personalized assessments to ensure each child's growth aligns with their individual learning goals at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What languages are taught at Chroma Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: The languages taught at Chroma Early Learning Academy include Spanish and Mandarin, providing children with a diverse linguistic foundation. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the daily schedule like at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The daily schedule at Chroma Early Learning Academy includes structured activities such as circle time, learning sessions, playtime, and meals, all designed to foster growth and development in a nurturing environment at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

schemas.name: Kimberly Statham
schemas.description:
Kimberly was born and raised in nearby Fayetteville, GA, and is a proud mother of three boys. She enjoys spending quality time with her family and brings a warm, nurturing spirit to all that she does.

With over 20 years of experience in Early Childhood Education, Kimberly’s journey has been nothing short of inspiring. She began her leadership career at the remarkable age of 18, stepping into the role of Director early on. Kimberly is a graduate of the University of West Georgia, where she earned her Bachelor’s degree in Psychology and Criminology. Though her studies were broad, her heart has always remained rooted in her true passion—working with and supporting children.

mainEntity.name: What is the adult to child ratio in drop in daycare?

acceptedAnswer.text: The adult to child ratio in drop-in daycare is essential for ensuring quality care and supervision. Typically, the ratio is 1 adult for every 4 to 6 children, depending on the age group, to promote a safe and nurturing environment.

schemas.name: Ranae Johnson
schemas.description:
Originally from Florida, Renae has lived in Georgia for 21 years. She is a proud mother of two beautiful daughters and a grandmother to three talented grandchildren. With over 28 years of experience in Early Childhood Education, Renae has served in various roles, including Teacher, Support Service Coordinator, Facilities Coordinator, Family Partner, and Director. Her passion for early childhood education shines through in every role she takes on, and she is deeply committed to nurturing the growth and development of young learners.

Outside of her professional life, Renae enjoys spending time with family and friends, shopping (especially for shoes!), attending jazz and motorcycle events, and riding her Harley.

schemas.name: Mcdonough
schemas.description: Chroma Early Learning Academy in McDonough provides high-quality childcare and early childhood education for children ages 6 weeks to 13 years. Open Monday through Friday from 6:30 AM to 6:30 PM, we support busy families with comprehensive programs including infant care, toddler care, preschool, Georgia Pre-K, before- and after-school care, and summer camps. Our STEAM-based curriculum promotes creativity, problem-solving, and critical thinking, while nutritious meals are provided daily. With secure facilities featuring video surveillance and keypad access, plus real-time updates through the Procare Parent Engagement app, families trust Chroma McDonough for safe, nurturing, and engaging early education. Schedule a tour today to see how we help children learn, grow, and thrive.

acceptedAnswer.text: The philosophy of Chroma Early Learning Academy centers on nurturing a child's natural curiosity through a STEAM-based curriculum, fostering creativity, critical thinking, and a love for learning in a supportive environment.

mainEntity.name: How does the academy assess student progress?

acceptedAnswer.text: The academy assesses student progress through regular observations, developmental screenings, and individualized assessments that align with our STEAM-based curriculum, ensuring each child's growth is effectively tracked at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What resources are available for parents?

mainEntity.name: Are there summer programs offered?

acceptedAnswer.text: The academy promotes social skills through collaborative activities, group projects, and guided interactions, fostering teamwork and communication among children. worksFor.name: Cherokee Academy by Chroma, Canton GA

schemas.description:
Nadine has devoted over 16 years to early childhood education, beginning her journey at just 16 years old.

With an associate's degree in Early Childhood Development, she brings both expertise and heartfelt passion to her role. Nadine is known for creating nurturing, enriching environments that support both children and staff.

Outside of work, she enjoys life with her husband, teenage son, and energetic toddler daughter. Her blend of personal and professional experience shapes her compassionate, family-centered leadership at Cherokee Academy.

schemas.name: Kiticha Kelly
schemas.description:
With 25 years of experience in early childhood education, Kiticha brings a deep commitment to nurturing young minds and fostering growth through compassionate leadership.

Her lifelong passion for guiding children makes her an invaluable asset to our leadership team at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

Outside the classroom, Kiticha is an avid traveler and history enthusiast who finds joy in discovering new places, reading, and relaxing over a good cup of tea. She's also a proud pet parent to a Cane Corso, a long-haired Chihuahua, and a Maine Coon cat. Family is central to her life one sibling shares her dedication to early education as a director, while another captures the world through fashion photography.

Kiticha’s love for learning, care, and exploration beautifully reflects the heart of our mission at Chroma.

employee.name: Kiticha Kelly
employee.description:
With 25 years of experience in early childhood education, Kiticha brings a deep commitment to nurturing young minds and fostering growth through compassionate leadership.

Her lifelong passion for guiding children makes her an invaluable asset to our leadership team at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

Outside the classroom, Kiticha is an avid traveler and history enthusiast who finds joy in discovering new places, reading, and relaxing over a good cup of tea. She's also a proud pet parent to a Cane Corso, a long-haired Chihuahua, and a Maine Coon cat. Family is central to her life one sibling shares her dedication to early education as a director, while another captures the world through fashion photography.

Kiticha’s love for learning, care, and exploration beautifully reflects the heart of our mission at Chroma.

employee.name: Lanitra Smith
employee.description:
Hello my name is Lanitra Smith, I go by Ms. Nickey in the Child Development industry. I began my career in 1991 as a substitute teacher for a Preschool class.Not knowing that I was walking into my purpose. After three months of working. I became third in charge. Well after that I must say things begin to develop. I started keeping kids at home and later opened up my first center as director and owner in 1994.I had a great 24 years running Nursery Rhymes Child Care Center. In those  years I went on to get my TCC. In  2018 I had to make one of the hardest decisions I ever had to make and that was  to close my business. 

I am currently in school, with 6 credits left  before I obtain my Bachelor of Science in Business. I am the proud mother of one handsome son and a beautiful grandson. I love my God .Dancing, spreading time with family and friends and watching sports.

schemas.caption: Chroma Early Learning Academy building exterior with colorful signage, surrounded by greenery and a no parking area, located in Marietta, GA.

schemas.name: Sonia Atkins
schemas.description:
My name is Sonia Atkins, and I’m honored to be part of the Chroma Family. Joining Chroma of West Cobb has been an exciting journey filled with connection, growth, and purpose. I’m passionate about creating a nurturing, joyful, and enriching environment for our families and children each day.


Originally from Walterboro, South Carolina, I relocated to Georgia as a young girl. I’m the proud wife of my high school sweetheart—married for 36 years—mother to four amazing sons, and grandmother to six beautiful grandchildren. Family is my foundation, and I love spending time with them, dancing, singing, and enjoying life’s simple joys.


I began my career in childcare at age 16 and never left the field. I hold an Associate’s Degree in Early Childhood Education, a Bachelor of Science in Management, and as of April 2025, I’ll proudly hold a Master’s of Science in Psychology. I’m certified in First Aid, CPR, and Director Training, and hold licensure in multiple areas that support effective, joyful classrooms.


Teaching has always been my passion.s an educator and leader, I strive to inspire children to dream big and shine bright—because, in my eyes, the stars are just the beginning.

employee.name: Sonia Atkins
employee.description:
My name is Sonia Atkins, and I’m honored to be part of the Chroma Family. Joining Chroma of West Cobb has been an exciting journey filled with connection, growth, and purpose. I’m passionate about creating a nurturing, joyful, and enriching environment for our families and children each day.


Originally from Walterboro, South Carolina, I relocated to Georgia as a young girl. I’m the proud wife of my high school sweetheart—married for 36 years—mother to four amazing sons, and grandmother to six beautiful grandchildren. Family is my foundation, and I love spending time with them, dancing, singing, and enjoying life’s simple joys.


I began my career in childcare at age 16 and never left the field. I hold an Associate’s Degree in Early Childhood Education, a Bachelor of Science in Management, and as of April 2025, I’ll proudly hold a Master’s of Science in Psychology. I’m certified in First Aid, CPR, and Director Training, and hold licensure in multiple areas that support effective, joyful classrooms.


Teaching has always been my passion.s an educator and leader, I strive to inspire children to dream big and shine bright—because, in my eyes, the stars are just the beginning.

mainEntity.name: What programs are offered at Chroma Early Learning Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy offers a variety of programs including childcare and preschool services, all centered around a STEAM-based curriculum designed to foster creativity and critical thinking in young learners at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How can I enroll my child in the Jonesboro campus?

acceptedAnswer.text: Enrolling your child in the Jonesboro campus is simple; just visit our website to complete the enrollment form or contact us directly for assistance. We look forward to welcoming your family to Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What are the hours of operation for Chroma Early Learning Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: The hours of operation for Chroma Early Learning Academy are Monday through Friday, from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How can I contact Chroma Early Learning Academy for more information?

acceptedAnswer.text: To contact Chroma Early Learning Academy for more information, you can reach out via phone or email, or visit our website for additional details. We look forward to assisting you at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What age groups does Chroma serve?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy serves children from infants to preschool age, providing a nurturing environment for development and learning. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are meals provided at the academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: Meals are provided at the academy to ensure that children receive nutritious and balanced options throughout the day. This service is part of the comprehensive care offered at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the curriculum focus at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The curriculum focus at Chroma Early Learning Academy is a STEAM-based approach, integrating science, technology, engineering, arts, and mathematics to foster creativity and critical thinking in young learners at our academy.

mainEntity.name: How are teachers qualified at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: Teachers at Chroma Early Learning Academy are qualified through a combination of education, certifications, and ongoing professional development to ensure they provide the highest quality of early childhood education.

mainEntity.name: What safety measures are in place?

acceptedAnswer.text: Safety measures in place at Chroma Early Learning Academy include secure entry points, regular safety drills, and trained staff to ensure a safe environment for children. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Is there a parent involvement program?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Chroma Early Learning Academy offers a robust parent involvement program that encourages families to engage actively in their child's learning and development. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What extracurricular activities are available?

acceptedAnswer.text: The extracurricular activities available at Chroma Early Learning Academy include art, music, and outdoor play, designed to enhance creativity and physical development. These activities complement our STEAM-based curriculum, fostering a well-rounded educational experience at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How often are parent-teacher conferences held?

acceptedAnswer.text: Parent-teacher conferences at Chroma Early Learning Academy are held twice a year, providing opportunities for parents to discuss their child's progress and development with educators.

mainEntity.name: What is the student-to-teacher ratio?

acceptedAnswer.text: The student-to-teacher ratio at Chroma Early Learning Academy is designed to ensure personalized attention and support for each child, fostering a nurturing learning environment. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there any enrollment fees?

acceptedAnswer.text: Enrollment fees are applicable at Chroma Early Learning Academy. For detailed information regarding the specific amounts and payment options, please contact our admissions office directly at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the process for enrollment?

acceptedAnswer.text: The process for enrollment involves completing an application form, submitting required documents, and scheduling a tour of the campus. For detailed steps and assistance, please contact Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How can I schedule a campus tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: To schedule a campus tour, simply fill out the request form on our website or contact us directly via phone or email. We look forward to welcoming you to Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What are the benefits of a STEAM curriculum?

acceptedAnswer.text: The benefits of a STEAM curriculum include fostering creativity, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, which prepare children for future academic and career success. This approach also encourages collaboration and hands-on learning at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there any discounts for siblings?

acceptedAnswer.text: Discounts for siblings are available at Chroma Early Learning Academy to help families save on tuition.

mainEntity.name: What is the academys philosophy on learning?

acceptedAnswer.text: The academy's philosophy on learning emphasizes a holistic, STEAM-based approach that nurtures curiosity and creativity in children. This fosters a love for learning and encourages exploration, ensuring a well-rounded educational experience at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma support children with special needs?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy supports children with special needs by providing individualized learning plans, specialized resources, and a nurturing environment that promotes inclusion and growth.

mainEntity.name: What are the daily schedules like?

acceptedAnswer.text: Daily schedules at Chroma Early Learning Academy are structured to provide a balanced mix of educational activities, playtime, and rest, ensuring a nurturing environment for children.

mainEntity.name: Are there opportunities for outdoor play?

acceptedAnswer.text: Opportunities for outdoor play are abundant at Chroma Early Learning Academy, as we prioritize physical activity and exploration in our curriculum. Children enjoy safe and engaging outdoor spaces to foster their development and creativity at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What types of assessments are used?

acceptedAnswer.text: The types of assessments used include observational assessments, developmental screenings, and progress monitoring tools to ensure each child's growth and learning needs are met at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma handle discipline?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy handles discipline through positive reinforcement and constructive guidance, fostering a supportive environment that promotes understanding and respect among children. This approach encourages self-regulation and social skills development at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the academys policy on vaccinations?

acceptedAnswer.text: The academy's policy on vaccinations requires that all enrolled children are up-to-date on their immunizations to ensure a safe and healthy environment. This policy is in place at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there any summer programs available?

acceptedAnswer.text: Summer programs are available at Chroma Early Learning Academy, offering engaging activities that promote learning and fun during the break.

mainEntity.name: How can I provide feedback to the academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: Providing feedback to the academy can be done through our online form or by contacting us directly via email or phone. We value your input at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What are the qualifications of the staff?

acceptedAnswer.text: The qualifications of the staff at Chroma Early Learning Academy include degrees in early childhood education, specialized training in STEAM methodologies, and ongoing professional development to ensure high-quality care and instruction.

mainEntity.name: Is transportation provided for students?

acceptedAnswer.text: Transportation is not provided for students at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the academys approach to diversity?

acceptedAnswer.text: The academy's approach to diversity emphasizes inclusivity and respect for all backgrounds, fostering a learning environment where children can appreciate differences and develop empathy. This commitment to diversity is integral to the mission of Chroma Early Learning Academy.

employee.name: Meghan Mcneil
employee.description:
My name is Meghan McNeal, and I am the Assistant Director for Chroma ELA at
Rivergreen. I am a proud mom of three children and four fur- babies. My Husband and I have a Highschooler, one in Elementary, and one in Preschool at Rivergreen. We have been happily married 9 years this year and going strong! We are a highly active family with the
Jeep and believe in supporting our community. We try to go on Jeep rides as
well can that support causes such as Children’s Haven or someone who happens to be.
in need. We believe in trying to get outside and being active as much as we can! I am.
big into art and science field when it comes to home life activities such as baking or
doing fun science experiments.

I found my love for teaching within childcare after having my third child and returning to
a job that would allow me to bring him. While beginning to gain my experience working
With all age groups, I gain my TCC in December 2022. As I continued my path in
childcare, I was able to use my background to work in GA PreK from 2024 to 2025. I
have continued my education throughout the years but taking courses that provide me with
further knowledge. I had the opportunity to gain experience even further with Chroma,
when they offered me to work as an Assistant Director. I have management experience.
from years prior running the front office in the Vet field. This opportunity I grateful took.
and enjoyed working not only inside and outside our classrooms. My goal is to have the
facility not only is the best, but to truly give families what their children deserve. Our
goal is for it to feel like family for the children we care for and the staff who love them.
This opportunity allows me to give back to the company, the staff, and all who have support 
all my dreams. I cannot wait for the future holds for everyone, and the children we nurture!

schemas.description:
Keishawn brings 9 years of Early Childhood Education experience, including serving as a Special Needs teacher, teaching both 5th and 8th grade, and working with Head Start. His dedication to fostering the intellectual, social, emotional, linguistic, and physical development of children aligns perfectly with our mission and values at Chroma.

Beyond his professional expertise, Keishawn is married and the proud Godfather to three children. His passion for education, combined with his leadership skills and commitment to families, will be an asset as we grow our South Cobb location.

Please join me in giving Keishawn a warm Chroma welcome! We look forward to the wonderful things he will bring to our team and the positive impact he will make on our children, families, and staff.

mainEntity.name: What daycare options are available in Milton, GA?

acceptedAnswer.text: The daycare options available in Milton, GA, include various programs focusing on early childhood education, such as the GA Pre-K program and the Prismpath™ curriculum offered by Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does the Prismpath™ curriculum benefit early childhood education?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Prismpath™ curriculum enhances early childhood education by promoting holistic development through engaging, hands-on learning experiences tailored to each child's unique needs, ensuring a strong foundation for lifelong learning at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What programs does Chroma Early Learning Academy offer for preschoolers?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy offers a variety of preschool programs designed to foster early childhood development, including the Prismpath™ curriculum and the GA Pre-K program. These programs ensure a strong educational foundation for preschoolers at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What are the hours of operation for daycare?

acceptedAnswer.text: The hours of operation for daycare at Chroma Early Learning Academy are from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM, providing flexible care for families in Milton, GA, at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How do I enroll my child in daycare?

acceptedAnswer.text: Enrolling your child in daycare is a straightforward process. Simply visit our website to complete the enrollment form or contact us directly for assistance. We look forward to welcoming your family to Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What age groups does Chroma serve?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy serves children from infants to pre-kindergarten age, providing a nurturing environment for each developmental stage. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are meals provided at Chroma Early Learning Academy?

acceptedAnswer.text: Meals are provided at Chroma Early Learning Academy, ensuring that children receive nutritious and balanced options throughout the day. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the teacher-to-student ratio in classrooms?

acceptedAnswer.text: The teacher-to-student ratio in classrooms is designed to ensure personalized attention and support for each child. At Chroma Early Learning Academy, we maintain a low ratio to foster a nurturing and effective learning environment.

mainEntity.name: How is the Prismpath™ curriculum structured?

acceptedAnswer.text: The structure of the Prismpath™ curriculum is designed to foster holistic development through a blend of play-based learning, hands-on activities, and age-appropriate challenges, ensuring a comprehensive educational experience at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What activities are included in the preschool program?

acceptedAnswer.text: The activities included in the preschool program focus on holistic development, featuring creative arts, music, outdoor play, and foundational literacy and numeracy skills, all designed to foster a love for learning at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there outdoor play areas for children?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy has dedicated outdoor play areas designed for children to explore and engage in physical activities safely. These spaces enhance their learning experience and promote healthy development at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma ensure child safety?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy ensures child safety through rigorous safety protocols, including secure campus access, trained staff, and regular safety drills to create a secure environment for all children. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What qualifications do the teachers have?

acceptedAnswer.text: The qualifications of the teachers include degrees in early childhood education, specialized training, and ongoing professional development to ensure high-quality instruction at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Is there a parent communication system in place?

acceptedAnswer.text: A parent communication system is in place to ensure seamless updates and information sharing between our staff and families. This system helps keep parents informed about their child's progress and any important announcements at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the cost of enrollment at Chroma?

acceptedAnswer.text: The cost of enrollment at Chroma varies based on the specific program and age group. For detailed pricing information, please contact us directly at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there any special programs for toddlers?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy offers specialized programs for toddlers that focus on early development through engaging activities and the Prismpath™ curriculum. These programs are designed to nurture curiosity and build foundational skills. Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: How often are parent-teacher conferences held?

acceptedAnswer.text: Parent-teacher conferences are held twice a year at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: What is the process for transitioning to kindergarten?

acceptedAnswer.text: The process for transitioning to kindergarten involves preparing children emotionally and academically, ensuring they are ready for the new environment. At Chroma Early Learning Academy, we support this transition through tailored activities and communication with parents.

mainEntity.name: Are there field trips included in the curriculum?

acceptedAnswer.text: Field trips are an integral part of the curriculum at Chroma Early Learning Academy, providing children with hands-on learning experiences that enhance their education.

mainEntity.name: How does Chroma support children with special needs?

acceptedAnswer.text: Chroma Early Learning Academy supports children with special needs by providing individualized learning plans, trained staff, and inclusive classroom environments that cater to diverse learning styles and abilities.

mainEntity.name: What is the philosophy behind the Prismpath™ curriculum?

acceptedAnswer.text: The philosophy behind the Prismpath™ curriculum emphasizes holistic development, fostering creativity, critical thinking, and a love for learning in young children. This approach ensures that each child’s unique strengths are nurtured at Chroma Early Learning Academy.

mainEntity.name: Are there opportunities for parental involvement?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes! Our locations serving Lithia Springs participate in the Georgia Lottery Pre-K program. It is tuition-free for all 4-year-olds living in Georgia.

mainEntity.name: How do I enroll my child in Lithia Springs?

schemas.description: Early childhood education refers to organized learning experiences and caregiving for children from birth through age eight that intentionally promote cognitive, social-emotional, physical, and language development. schemas.name: Guardería y Preescolar en Powder Springs
schemas.description: Programs in Powder SpringsParent's Day Out • Camp ( Summer, Winter, Fall) • Schoolagers • Pre-K / GA Pre-K • Pre-K Prep • Preschool • Toddlers • Infant Care

hasOfferCatalog.name: Escuelas que sirven a Powder Springs

mainEntity.name: ¿Ofrecen GA Lottery Pre-K en Powder Springs?

acceptedAnswer.text: ¡Sí! Nuestras ubicaciones que sirven a Powder Springs participan en el programa Georgia Lottery Pre-K. Es gratuito para todos los niños de 4 años que viven en Georgia.

mainEntity.name: ¿Proporcionan transporte desde las escuelas de Powder Springs?

acceptedAnswer.text: Proporcionamos transporte seguro en autobús desde la mayoría de las principales escuelas primarias en el Distrito Escolar de Cobb. Consulte la página del campus específico para obtener una lista completa.

mainEntity.name: ¿Qué edades aceptan en sus centros de Powder Springs?

acceptedAnswer.text: Servimos a niños desde 6 semanas de edad (Cuidado de Bebés) hasta 12 años (Después de la Escuela). También ofrecemos una opción de Preparación para Pre-K en ubicaciones seleccionadas.

mainEntity.name: ¿Cómo inscribo a mi hijo en Powder Springs?

acceptedAnswer.text: La mejor manera de comenzar es programando un recorrido en su ubicación preferida. Puede reservar en línea o llamarnos directamente. Lo guiaremos a través del proceso de inscripción y responderemos todas sus preguntas.

mainEntity.name: ¿Qué edades aceptan en sus centros de North Hall?

acceptedAnswer.text: Servimos a niños desde 6 semanas de edad (Cuidado de Bebés) hasta 12 años (Después de la Escuela). También ofrecemos una opción de Preparación para Pre-K en ubicaciones seleccionadas.

mainEntity.name: ¿Cómo inscribo a mi hijo en North Hall?

acceptedAnswer.text: La mejor manera de comenzar es programando un recorrido en su ubicación preferida. Puede reservar en línea o llamarnos directamente. Lo guiaremos a través del proceso de inscripción y responderemos todas sus preguntas.

schemas.name: Campus Shenandoah, Newnan GA
schemas.description: At Chroma Early Learning @ Newnan, we believe early childhood education should be filled with discovery, joy, and supportive relationships. Our caring teachers create a welcoming childcare environment where children feel loved, encouraged, and confident to take on new challenges. Through play-based learning, creative exploration, and structured learning moments, we support each child’s social, emotional, and academic development. We are proud to partner with Newnan families to build a strong foundation for lifelong learning.

schemas.name: North Hall Campus, Murraysville
schemas.description: Chroma Early Learning @ North Hall is a trusted early childhood education center offering high-quality childcare, preschool, and pre-K programs. Our experienced teachers provide a safe, nurturing environment with a hands-on learning curriculum that supports children’s social, emotional, and academic growth. We focus on kindergarten readiness, creativity, and building confidence in every child while partnering with North Hall families to support lifelong learning

employee.name: Melissa Leonard
employee.description:
Melissa Leonard is a passionate leader in early childhood education and a proud mother of three. Born and raised in Cumming, Georgia, she recently relocated to Gainesville, where she continues to build strong connections within the community. Melissa enjoys spending her free time supporting her children’s activities—watching her son play football and cheering on her daughters at their cheer events. She is also a devoted Georgia Bulldogs fan.
With a deep-rooted passion for early childhood education, Melissa is driven by her desire to make a meaningful and lasting impact in the lives of children. She is dedicated to fostering strong, trusting relationships with families and believes in creating a nurturing, supportive, and high-quality learning environment where every child and family feels valued. Her commitment, energy, and genuine heart for children are evident in all that she does.

schemas.name: Midway Campus, Alpharetta GA
schemas.description: At Chroma Early Learning Academy in Alpharetta, GA, we provide high-quality childcare and early childhood education to help every child get a strong start. Our safe, nurturing learning environment supports families in Alpharetta, Cumming, and Milton. Through dedicated care, play-based learning, and continuous quality improvement, we nurture each child’s potential while strengthening our local community.

employee.name: Chelsea Brown
employee.description:
Chelsey Brown is a dedicated early childhood education leader with a deep belief that the early years are the most impactful period in a child’s life. She is passionate about building meaningful relationships with children and families and creating supportive, nurturing environments where everyone can grow and flourish. 
Throughout her career, Chelsey has worked as a classroom teacher, education specialist, consultant, and Director of Children’s Experience in a museum setting—all within the field of early care and learning. She also spent several years living and teaching abroad in China, including time in Beijing and Shanghai. These experiences shaped her global perspective and deepened her appreciation for creativity, connection, and cultural understanding in education.
As an educator and leader, Chelsey is committed to creating positive, engaging spaces for both children and staff. Her guiding expectations are simple and intentional: be safe, be kind, do your best, and have fun.

Education
Chelsey earned her bachelor’s degree in Human Environmental Science with a concentration in Human Development from The University of Alabama (Roll Tide!). In 2021, she completed a master’s degree in Early Childhood Education Leadership and, in August 2025, earned a second master’s degree in Psychology.

schemas.name: Campus South Cobb, Austell
schemas.description: Chroma Early Learning Academy @ South Cobb provides high-quality childcare and early childhood education for families in Austell and Mableton. Our programs for infants, toddlers, preschool, and Georgia Pre-K nurture creativity, confidence, and curiosity through the Chroma Spectrum Curriculum—a hands-on, play-based approach aligned with Georgia Early Learning and Development Standards (GELDS). Families trust us for our safe, engaging classrooms, experienced teachers, nutritious meals, and strong parent communication. Discover why Chroma Early Learning Academy is the trusted choice for early learning and child development in South Cobb.

employee.name: Keishawn Meredeith
employee.description:
Keishawn brings 9 years of Early Childhood Education experience, including serving as a Special Needs teacher, teaching both 5th and 8th grade, and working with Head Start. His dedication to fostering the intellectual, social, emotional, linguistic, and physical development of children aligns perfectly with our mission and values at Chroma.

Beyond his professional expertise, Keishawn is married and the proud Godfather to three children. His passion for education, combined with his leadership skills and commitment to families, will be an asset as we grow our South Cobb location.

Please join me in giving Keishawn a warm Chroma welcome! We look forward to the wonderful things he will bring to our team and the positive impact he will make on our children, families, and staff.

employee.name: Meghan Mcneil
employee.description:
My name is Meghan McNeal, and I am the Assistant Director for Chroma ELA at
Rivergreen. I am a proud mom of three children and four fur- babies. My Husband and I have a Highschooler, one in Elementary, and one in Preschool at Rivergreen. We have been happily married 9 years this year and going strong! We are a highly active family with the
Jeep and believe in supporting our community. We try to go on Jeep rides as
well can that support causes such as Children’s Haven or someone who happens to be.
in need. We believe in trying to get outside and being active as much as we can! I am.
big into art and science field when it comes to home life activities such as baking or
doing fun science experiments.

I found my love for teaching within childcare after having my third child and returning to
a job that would allow me to bring him. While beginning to gain my experience working
With all age groups, I gain my TCC in December 2022. As I continued my path in
childcare, I was able to use my background to work in GA PreK from 2024 to 2025. I
have continued my education throughout the years but taking courses that provide me with
further knowledge. I had the opportunity to gain experience even further with Chroma,
when they offered me to work as an Assistant Director. I have management experience.
from years prior running the front office in the Vet field. This opportunity I grateful took.
and enjoyed working not only inside and outside our classrooms. My goal is to have the
facility not only is the best, but to truly give families what their children deserve. Our
goal is for it to feel like family for the children we care for and the staff who love them.
This opportunity allows me to give back to the company, the staff, and all who have support 
all my dreams. I cannot wait for the future holds for everyone, and the children we nurture!

employee.name: Shekrelia Davis
employee.description:
Hi Chroma Early Learning Academy Friends,

My name is Shekrelia Davis. I have over twenty years of experience working with children in a childcare facility and owning and operating a home daycare center for six years. I love and enjoy interacting and engaging with children, whether it is through reading, music, laughter, or just being silly. I get complete joy whenever a child laughs; it brightens my day. 

I am a true Georgia Peach. I was born and raised in Decatur, Georgia. So, you know that means I am a diehard Atlanta Falcons, Braves, Hawks, and UGA Bull Dogs fan for life!

I have a Bachelor of Science Degree in Business Management and am currently working on obtaining a Master of Education in Early Childhood Education.

I am the mother of two young men who blessed me with seven beautiful grandchildren. I am an active member at my church and work faithfully within the Women’s Ministry (Crowned Jewels).

I am a “Finer” Woman of Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Inc., Sigma Omicron Gwinnett Chapter. Where we demonstrate a commitment to scholarship, service, sisterhood, and finer womanhood.

schemas.name: Campus West Cobb, Marietta
schemas.description: Chroma Early Learning Academy of West Cobb provides high-quality childcare and early childhood education for families in the West Cobb area. Our state-of-the-art facility offers a safe, nurturing, and engaging environment where children can learn, grow, and thrive. We prioritize continuous quality improvement (CQI) and maintain open communication with families to build strong partnerships in each child’s early learning journey.

employee.name: Sonia Atkins
employee.description:
My name is Sonia Atkins, and I’m honored to be part of the Chroma Family. Joining Chroma of West Cobb has been an exciting journey filled with connection, growth, and purpose. I’m passionate about creating a nurturing, joyful, and enriching environment for our families and children each day.


Originally from Walterboro, South Carolina, I relocated to Georgia as a young girl. I’m the proud wife of my high school sweetheart—married for 36 years—mother to four amazing sons, and grandmother to six beautiful grandchildren. Family is my foundation, and I love spending time with them, dancing, singing, and enjoying life’s simple joys.


I began my career in childcare at age 16 and never left the field. I hold an Associate’s Degree in Early Childhood Education, a Bachelor of Science in Management, and as of April 2025, I’ll proudly hold a Master’s of Science in Psychology. I’m certified in First Aid, CPR, and Director Training, and hold licensure in multiple areas that support effective, joyful classrooms.


Teaching has always been my passion.s an educator and leader, I strive to inspire children to dream big and shine bright—because, in my eyes, the stars are just the beginning.

employee.name: Lanitra Smith
employee.description:
Hello my name is Lanitra Smith, I go by Ms. Nickey in the Child Development industry. I began my career in 1991 as a substitute teacher for a Preschool class.Not knowing that I was walking into my purpose. After three months of working. I became third in charge. Well after that I must say things begin to develop. I started keeping kids at home and later opened up my first center as director and owner in 1994.I had a great 24 years running Nursery Rhymes Child Care Center. In those  years I went on to get my TCC. In  2018 I had to make one of the hardest decisions I ever had to make and that was  to close my business. 

I am currently in school, with 6 credits left  before I obtain my Bachelor of Science in Business. I am the proud mother of one handsome son and a beautiful grandson. I love my God .Dancing, spreading time with family and friends and watching sports.

schemas.name: Kimberly Statham
schemas.description:
Kimberly was born and raised in nearby Fayetteville, GA, and is a proud mother of three boys. She enjoys spending quality time with her family and brings a warm, nurturing spirit to all that she does.

With over 20 years of experience in Early Childhood Education, Kimberly’s journey has been nothing short of inspiring. She began her leadership career at the remarkable age of 18, stepping into the role of Director early on. Kimberly is a graduate of the University of West Georgia, where she earned her Bachelor’s degree in Psychology and Criminology. Though her studies were broad, her heart has always remained rooted in her true passion—working with and supporting children.

schemas.name: Deanna Kauffman
schemas.description:
With five years of experience in both teaching and management, DeAnna is a compassionate leader who understands the lasting impact of early childhood experiences.

She is dedicated to creating a warm, engaging environment where curiosity, creativity, and confidence can flourish. At Chroma ELA, DeAnna’s nurturing approach supports not only children but their families, building strong, trusting relationships along the way.

At home, she finds joy in spending time with her husband and two daughters whether they’re playing board games, cooking, or making music together. DeAnna’s blend of professional expertise and heartfelt care makes her a valued partner in every child’s growth and success.
